  • Description: SUPERVISOR CALLED IN A LEAKER TO THE DMP. DMP DISPATCHED A RESPONDER WITH FULL PPE AND SPILL CART. RESPONDER ARRIVED ON SCENE AND CONSULTED WITH THE DECISION TREE ON HOW TO PROCCED WITH THE CLEAN UP. RESPONDER FOLLOWED THE GUIDLINES IN THE DECISION TREE AND CLEANED UP THE SPILL. RESPONDER BROUGHT BACK THE LEAKER FOR PROPER DISPOSAL. LEAKER WAS DISPOSED OF FOLLOWING GUIDLINES

item.title: Report X-2024010124
item.description:
Report X-2024010124

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-11T15:12:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-03
  • City: SHREWSBURY
  • State: MA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: HAZARDOUS MATERIAL WAS DISCOVERED AT THE AIR TRAILER. EMPLOYEE WAS REMOVING THE SHIPPING PAPERS FROM THE POUCH AND NOTICED THAT THE PAIL WAS LEAKING INTO THE POUCH. EMPLOYEE WASHED HANDS FOR APPROPRIATE TIME AS STATE IN THE SAFETY DATA SHEET. RESPONDER NOTICED A PUNCTURE HOLE IN THE TOP OF THE PAIL NEAR THE SHIPPING PAPERS POUCH. PACKAGE WAS CONTAINED AND BROUGHT TO THE DMP USING THE DECISON TREE FOR OXIDIZER LIQUIDS. DAMAGE WAS THEN PROCESSED USING THE DECISION TREE FOR OXIDIZERS.

item.title: Report E-2024010028
item.description:
Report E-2024010028

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-11T15:12:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-02
  • City: NORTH CHARLESTON
  • State: SC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal NCS experienced a UN3267 Ferrogard 903 release from a 5-gallon poly pail. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 5-gallons of product released to a 5’ x 16’ area of the trailer floor due to a puncture. Absorbents were deployed and worked into the impacted area. The damaged pail, impacted absorbents, debris, and PPE were then containerized into a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0

  • Description: HAZMAT AUDITOR SAID ONE OF THE PACKAGES ON THEIR TRAM HAD A STRONG CHEMICAL ODOR COMING FROM IT AND POINTED OUT A PACKAGE WITH CLASS 5.1 AND CLASS 8 HAZARD DIAMONDS. INSPECTING THE PACKAGE, RESPONDER FOUND 4 1GAL CONTAINERS WITH VENTED CAPS AND 1 OF THE CONTAINER CAPS WAS MISSING THE PAPER SEAL UNDERNEATH WHICH ALLOWED SOME OF THE LIQUID TO DRIBBLE ONTO THE CARDBOARD INSIDE THE PACKAGE.

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: PACKAGE INSIDE LEAKED OUT BEING SOAKED UP ON THE CARDBOARD BOX. HAD A BAD SMELL, AND THE ITEM INSIDE CONTAINING A SYMBOL THAT SHOW ETHYLENE TO BE EXPLOSIVE AND WAS SEALED OFF AND REQUEST OUTSIDE HELP WHICH A VENDOR PLACE IT INSIDE A DRUM. LATER ON, AN FWN FORM WAS PROCESSED AND THE GENERATOR AND BOX THAT CAME IN WAS SEPARATED DUE TO DISPOSAL VENDER REQUEST ONCE THE RECIEVED SDS SHEET. THE GENERATOR REMAINS INSIDE THE DRUM, BUT THE CARDBOARD BOX AND LEFTOVERS REMAIN TO BE PROCESS.

item.title: Report E-2023120420
item.description:
Report E-2023120420

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-11T15:12:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-20
  • City: RICHFIELD
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ESTES EXPRESS LINES
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Hepaco was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 70ft-by-20ft area of the concrete terminal floor and estimated that seventy (70) gallons of material was released due to forklift damaging one (1) 275-gallon poly tote. Hepaco personnel deployed a neutralizer to the impacted area while on SCBA and later respirators and later once the neutralizing had been completed an absorbent was used to gather the spent material. Hepaco personnel recovered the spent material and containerized it into eight (8) 55-gallon poly drums. The remaining product in the damaged tote was transferred to a new tote and the damaged 275-gallon poly tote was cut up and placed into one (1) 55- gallon poly drum. The generated waste was staged onsite in a secure location prior to the contractor demobilization. The generated waste will remain onsite for the ESTES DGRM team to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2023120322
item.description:
Report E-2023120322

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-11T15:12:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-16
  • City: PARKERSBURG
  • State: WV
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CSX CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On December 16, 2023, at approximately 14:24 hours, personnel at the CSX Parkersburg, WV yard reported an odor of gas coming from the area of tank TILX 305535, residue: last contained Isoprene, stabilized. SPSI, a CSXT response contractor, responded and found TILX 305535 leaking from the top of the tank car. The tank car was isolated and the Shipper, Kraton Corp, was notified via CHEMTREC (Report 2023-1216-00057). SPSI inspected the railcar and found the sample line valve not fully closed and the secondary closure plug less than tool tight. The issue was identified and corrective actions were communicated to the shipper’s representative- Kel Fann (904-239-2238, Michael.Fann@kraton.com). Contractor personnel closed the sample line valve and secured the secondary closure plug. The car was released for transportation.

item.title: Report E-2024010119
item.description:
Report E-2024010119

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-10T15:11:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-29
  • City: LOUISVILLE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On December 29, 2023, one (1) 300-gallon tote of NA1993 was damaged during loading and released approximately 150-gallons of product to the trailer interior, pavement below, and the loading dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from TPM Group (TPM) to remediate the impacted site. TPM personnel deployed granular absorbent to the impacted trailer floor, dock floor and pavement below trailer and worked them in utilizing hand tools. Crews then utilized a vacuum pump to transfer the virgin product from the damaged tote to a new tote and secured for normal transport. All NA1993 impacted material was collected and containerized in four (4) 55-gallon drums and RLC personnel took possession of the four (4) 55-gallon drums and one (1) damaged 275-gallon tote to be added to the facility waste stream.

  • Description: On December 22, 2023, one (!) 55-gallon drum of UN1133 was damaged in transit and released approximately one and a half (1.5) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Lonestar Hazmat (LSH) to remediate the impacted site. LSH personnel utilized granular absorbents, hand tools, and a vacuum unit to remediate the UN1133-impacted trailer. All waste was collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum to be staged onsite for future disposal.

  • Description: On December 27, 2023, one (1) 375-gallon tote of UN2693 was punctured by a forklift and released approximately one hundred (100) gallons of product to the trailer interior, pavement beneath the trailer, and dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from LoneStar Hazmat (LSH) to remediate the impacted site. LSH personnel deployed granular absorbents to the UN2693-impacted trailer, dock floor, and asphalt parking lot and swept them in utilizing hand tools. All spent absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum to be staged onsite for future disposal. LSH personnel transferred the product from the damaged 330-gallon tote to one (1) new 330-gallon tote for further shipment.

  • City: LAREDO

  • Carrier/Reporter: LANDSTAR SYSTEM, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On December 21, 2023, at 1945 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Landstar personnel in Laredo, Texas regarding the release of a total of (2) quarts of SHIELD-BRITE ® VACATE (UN1719 Caustic Alkali Liquids, n.o.s. (Sodium Hydroxide, Potassium Hydroxide) 8, II) from (6) 5-gallon plastic pails. Contractors were dispatched to the site to perform all onsite clean-up activities. Upon arrival, contractors confirmed the release was caused by defective seals in the caps on top of the pails and contained to a 5’ x 6’ area on the trailer floor. Contractors were able to neutralize the release and clean it with absorbents and the proper PPE. All waste generated from addressing this release was containerized in (1) 55-gallon DF, and recovered product was placed in (2) 55-gallon DF's and then taken offsite by contractors.

  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal NCH experienced a UN2735 PRE-TECT 2040HP release from a 2700-pound metal tote. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 8-gallons of product released to the concrete dock floor and pads in a 2’ x 3’ area over the course of 2 weeks while awaiting a new tote for transfer. The release was caused by a steam leaking on the bottom fitting which was secured and contained on the dock. Once the new tote arrived onsite on 12/28/2023, the material was transferred for shipment on. All impacted pads, absorbents, and PPE were containerized into (2) 55-gallon poly drums. item.title: Report X-2024010048
item.description:
Report X-2024010048

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-09T06:14:28+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-24
  • City: LOUISVILLE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: DURING PACKAGE HANDLING OF AN AIR DECLARED HAZARDOUS MATERIAL PACKAGE CONTAINING HYDROCHLORIC ACID, THE BOTTOM OF THE PACKAGE BURST OPEN SPILLING THE INNER DANGEROUS GOOD CONTENTS. VAPORS AND FUMES BEGAN RELEASING CAUSING ONE WING OF THE FACILITY TO BE TEMPORARILY EVACUATED. OUTSIDE RESPONDER WAS CONTACTED TO RESPOND TO THE SPILL. THE PACKAGE CONTAINED 6 X 2.5 L GLASS BOTTLES OF HYDROCHLORIC ACID. TWO BOTTLES SHATTERED UPON HITTING THE CONCRETE FLOOR. THE BOTTLES MADE CONTACT WITH THE RIGHT SHIN AND FOOT OF THE PACKAGE HANDLER. EMPLOYEE REMOVED THE AFFECTED CLOTHING AND WAS SENT TO CONCENTRA URGENT CARE AS A PRECAUTIONARY MEASURE FOR POSSIBLE EXPOSURE. AFTER EXAMINATION THE EMPLOYEE WAS CLEARED TO RETURN TO WORK. A SECOND AIR DECLARED PACKAGE CONTAINING UN1090, ACETONE, PG II ALSO APPEARED TO BE LEAKING UNDER TRACKING 1Z18131X0101754877. THE PACKAGES WERE SHIPPED USING ACCOUNT NUMBER 18131X, SPECTRUM LABORATORY PROD INC. 769 JERSEY AVE. NEW BRUNSWICK NJ 08901.

  • Description: AT THE UPS FACILITY IN WARSAW, POLAND, AN AIR PACKAGE FROM THE NETHERLANDS TO GERMANY WAS FOUND TO CONTAIN ONE LITHIUM-ION BATTERY PACK REPLACEMENT WITHOUT EQUIPMENT. THE BATTERY PACK IS MODEL A2042 USED FOR APPLE IPOD PRO 11-INCH BATTERY REPLACEMENT. THE BOX ALSO CONTAINS ELEVEN NON-REGULATED 11-INCH SCREEN REPLACEMENTS WITHOUT LITHIUM BATTERIES. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX TO INDICATE A LITHIUM ION BATTERY WAS SHIPPING IN THE AIR NETWORK. THE PACKAGE WAS FLOWN ON A UPS FLIGHT FROM (CGN) COLOGNE, GERMANY TO DISCOVERY LOCATION (WAS) WARSAW, POLAND PRIOR TO THE UNDECLARED LITHIUM BATTERY DISCOVERY. THE PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED USING UPS ACCOUNT B56671, GREAT THINKERS HOLDING BV, HERCULES 6, GILZE 5126RK, NETHERLANDS.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was on load side wet, taken to cage for further inspection. Upon inspecting the inner contents there was an inner box with 2 x 5.0 liters plastic bottles of Rapicide PA Part A. The 1 plastic bottle was leaking from cap vent hole allowing .20 liters spill out. The other 2 x 5.0-liter plastic bottles of Rapicide PA Part B were not damaged. Facility procedures for damaged hazardous materials followed, contents contained and awaiting disposition. DescribePack: The one x 5.0-liter plastic bottle of Rapicide PA Part A was leaking from cap vent hole allowing .20 liters to spill out. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed in a red lined tote to contain the leaking damaged hazmat, taken to cage.

  • City: INDIANAPOLIS

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: BOTTLE NOTICED ON THE SECONDARY SLIDE LEAKING. MANAGEMENT NOTIFIED RESPONDERS. RESPONDERS DONNED PPE AND FOLLOWING THE DECISION TREE. DECISION TREE TOOK RESPONDERS TO THE CORROSIVE RESPONSE SHEET. GOGGLES, BOOTS, APRONS, AND GLOVES USING THE SILVER SHELD INNER LINERS. SCBA WAS NOT REQUIRED. ALL HAZARDS WERE FOLLOWED. PH WAS TESTED AS A 0. SODIUM BICARBONATE WAS USED AND AREA WAS RETESTED AS A 7. ALL MATERIAL WAS CONTAINERIZED INTO A LINED SPILL TRAY WITH A FIBER BROOK AND A PLASTIC DUSTPAN. ALL RESIDUE WAS REMOVED FORM THE SPILL LOCATION AND TRANSPORTED PACKAGE TO PACKAGE SERVICE CENTER FOR FURTHER PROCESSING.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was being transported via NC belt when it was knocked off, landing on its side. Package found by management and placed in hazmat spill tote, which is where it was found by QA. Package was emitting very strong, pungent odor. DescribePack: Package was soaked on multiple sides, cardboard/fiberboard was disintegrating. Upon inspection, 1 jug of muriatic acid was found to have a loose cap, causing roughly half of its contents to spill out and onto remaining 3 jugs. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package placed in hazmat spill tote with lid on to prevent fumes from escaping, then placed in hazmat cage underneath exhaust vent. Spillage treated with spill absorbent powder, powder placed in blue hazmat bag.

item.title: Report X-2023121148
item.description:
Report X-2023121148

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-05T18:16:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-15
  • City: EARTH CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: FULLY LABELED HAZ-MAT SHIPMENT WAS VISUALLY DISCOVERED STAINED IN APPEARANCE AND EMITTING A SOLVENT-LIKE ODOR BY THE LOADER ON THE PD-8. WITHOUT TOUCHING THE PKG HE EVACUATED THE AREA AND NOTIFIED HIS IMMEDIATE SUPERVISOR. DMP WAS CONTACTED AND WITHIN 5 MINUTES A DESIGNATED RESPONDER ARRIVED WITH A FULLY STOCKED SPILL CART AND DONNING THE PROPER PPE. AFTER FOLLOWING THE DECISION TREE APPROPRIATE RESPONSE SHEET THE DAMAGE WAS CONTAINED (NO SPILLAGE OUTSIDE OF CARTON), THEN TRANSPORTED TO THE DMP PROCESSING AREA. CLOSER INSPECTION REVEALED THAT THE TOP SECTION OF A METAL 5-GAL PAIL WAS SLIGHTLY DENTED, CREATING A BREACH THAT CAUSED APPROX. 12 OUNCES OF THE LIQUID TO LEAK FROM AND INTO THE CARTON. THERE WAS NO INTERNAL PACKING MATERIAL AND THE OUTER CARTON WAS A DOUBLEWALL FIBERBOARD BOX, RATED AT A 44 LBS/IN EDGE CRUSH TEST (ECT).

DONNING THE APPROPRIATE PPE AND USING THE DECISION TREE AND CORRECT RESPONSE SHEET IT WAS DETERMINED THAT THERE WAS NO LEAKAGE OUTSIDE OF THE CARTON AND THE PACKAGE WAS TRANSPORTED BACK TO THE DMP. UPON FURTHER INSPECTION IT WAS DETERMINED THAT THE CAPS ON EACH ONE OF THE FOUR INNER CONTAINERS WERE LOOSE BY 1/4 TURN AND APPROXIMATELY 2 OUNCES HAD LEAKED OUT ONTO THE OUTER CARTON AND INNER PARTION.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Admin spotted the package sitting top down next to an induction belt and alerted manager. Upon seeing the yellow leakage, area was covered in neutralizing agent to absorb the spill. Package appears to have fallen from to of belt and landed on the caps, causing the failure. No other damage was caused and location has been cleaned. DescribePack: Package appears to have landed on its caps, causing the failure. Spill covered an area of about 2 square meters. Caps were not loose, leading me to believe the impact cause the leakage. From what we were able to observe, there was no evident source of the leakage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Neutralizing absorbent agent was spread over spill, and package was placed in a containment bag and bin.

  • City: WILMINGTON

  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On November 21, 2023, one (1) 30-gallon drum of corrosive liquid was crushed and released approximately one and a half (1.5) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to remediate the impacted site. TLE personnel utilized hand tools, absorbents, and cleaners to remediate the site. All spent absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) 35-gallon drum. TLE placed the two (2) damaged 30-gallon drums into two (2) 55-gallon drums. All freight was re-secured and staged for further processing and shipping.

item.title: Report E-2024010006

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-15
  • City: CARPOLIS
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: SCHNEIDER BULK CARRIERS
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On November 15, 2023, at 1145 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Schneider personnel in Caraopolis, Pennsylvania regarding the release of approximately (1) gallon of Interox Hydrogen Peroxide Chemical Grade 50% (UN2014, 5.1, 8, II) from a tanker truck. Contractors were dispatched to clean up the release with absorbents and the proper PPE. Upon arrival, contractors confirmed that the release was contained to a small area of soil beneath the pump. Contractors were able to recover the impacted area using only hand tools. All waste generated was containerized in (1) 55-gallon poly drum which was staged onsite by contractors for proper disposal.

item.title: Report X-2023120210

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-22
  • City: BARSTOW
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: BNSF RAILWAY COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 11/22/23, the UTLX 205951 was found in the Barstow railyard to be leaking methanol from the top of the car. Hazmat responders isolated the car and the inspection revealed liquid leaking through the packing stem. The valve was found in the partially open position and was missing the packing retainer nut. The valve and release were secured with a pin. On 11/30/23, Graymar Env returned to further secure the valve by adding a packing sleeve and retainer nut. The car was pressure tested to verify integrity of repairs. No leaks were found. Shipper advised of need to get OTMA for movement to destination.

item.title: Report I-2023110039
item.description:
Report I-2023110039

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-12T00:37:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-04
  • City: BALTIMORE
  • State: MD
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: RSI LEASING, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 10.4.23 at approximately 7:45am, during a transfer of Ferric Chloride from railcar(PVSX213032) into All-Chem trailer (FRP64) the air valve on the trailer malfunctioned causing a release. The loader immediately climbed down from the railcar and closed both the internal and external valves on the trailer. Approximately 2 gallons of product was released, notifications were made to proper NS, RSI, PVS and All-Chem personnel. Hepaco arrived on site around 12pm, cleaned up, removed all debris and departed around 2:15pm.
